Entries.default: This stone entrance remains closed. The dial of carved symbols, previously inert, now emanate constant light.
[Leave.]
[Touch the door with the Rod of the Deep Hunter.]
This door opens into a lightless passage. Moisture clings to the rock walls, and stalactites hang down like fangs.

The door reacts at once. A stone panel shifts aside to reveal a circular dial engraved with symbols. 

This would appear to be a locking mechanism requiring a precise combination.
[Travel through the passage.]
[Rotate the dial counterclockwise.]
[Rotate the dial clockwise.]
The dial shows an engraving of the moon shining its pale, mournful light upon Eora.
The dial rolls over to a symbol of rain falling from thick, tempestuous storm clouds.
[Rotate the dial counterclockwise.]
[Rotate the dial clockwise.]
With a laborious groan, the dial shifts over to a symbol of two hands reaching for each other, their fingertips just barely meeting across the gap.
The dial centers on the Huana representation of Ondra, depicted with the head of an angler fish.
[Rotate the dial counterclockwise.]
[Rotate the dial clockwise.]
[Rotate the dial counterclockwise.]
[Rotate the dial clockwise.]
[Begin to manipulate the dial.]
[Leave.]
The dial rotates back to the symbol of the moon.
[Press the dial.]
You hear a grating, mechanical clunk of stone tumblers settling into place behind the door.
[Press the dial.]
You hear a grating, mechanical clunk of stone tumblers settling into place behind the door.
[Press the dial.]
You hear a grating, mechanical clunk of stone tumblers settling into place behind the door.
[Press the dial.]
You hear a grating, mechanical clunk of stone tumblers settling into place behind the door.
You hear clattering and whirring as the dial recedes into the door. There's a low rumble as the doorway opens inward, revealing a dark, narrow tunnel beyond.
This stone door is sealed shut. A few engraved symbols stand out among the other carvings and inscriptions. Apart from that, you find no evident means of opening the way.
As you approach the door, the carved stone flashes with ethereal light. You feel a faint, salty breeze gusting from an unseen source.
[Push against the door.]
The door stands resolutely shut. No amount of brute pressure will influence that one way or another.
[Search for a locking mechanism.]
As you search among the door's ancient carvings, you come upon a stone panel that seems to protect an internal mechanism. The panel remains fixed and unmoving.
You hear the clatter of tumblers resetting behind the door, and the engravings rotate back to the moon symbol. It doesn't seem like you're unlocking things in the correct order.
The clatter of massive stone tumblers echoes behind the wall as the combination lock resets itself. The dial must need to be rotated in a different order.
You navigate the dark, narrow tunnel - pressing your shoulders together to fit the passage.
The Nāga shaman hisses with disapproval.
[Study the symbols around the dial.]
Brushing aside a layer of dust reveals a circular dial of pictographs. Though you could not guess their relevance or relation to each other, you recognize the symbols themselves.
The next is a Huana symbol of Ondra, classically depicted with the head of an angler fish in her aspect as Ngati.
The first is a full moon, its light beaming down on Eora.
The next is a pair of hands reaching out for each other, their fingertips just barely making contact.
And the last is the rain, falling powerfully and inexorably.
[Punch the door.]
You slam your fist against the door with all your might, bloodying your knuckles in the process.
Someone chuckles. You aim a harsh look over your shoulder, and the laughter from your party abruptly goes quiet.
The stone door glows in response to the rod you recovered from the nāga.
The air beyond the passage is humid, reeking of stagnant water and something else - something old, which raises the hairs on the back of your neck.
[Go through anyway.]
[Turn back.]
As you take your first step, an ear-splitting roar rises in volume and echoes down the passage, shaking loose the surrounding rock.
[Read the inscription.]
Huana runes decorate the stone entrance: Ngati would not have gifted her chosen people a watery covenant unless they persisted in deserving it.
This sanctum is a covenant of our making. Only the sigil of the covenant and the words of my Devotion will open the way. ~Periki, Master of the Guild.
A faded inscription is nestled among the elaborate stone carvings.
